Go back to index | PHP CodeBrowser
Lib/Mvc/php_error.php
  1.    1  <?php
  2.    2     /**
  3.    3      * @license
  4.    4      * 
  5.    5      * PHP Error
  6.    6      * 
  7.    7      * Copyright (c) 2012 Joseph Lenton
  8.    8      * All rights reserved.
  9.    9      * 
  10.   10      * Redistribution and use in source and binary forms, with or without
  11.   11      * modification, are permitted provided that the following conditions are met:
  12.   12      *     * Redistributions of source code must retain the above copyright
  13.   13      *       notice, this list of conditions and the following disclaimer.
  14.   14      *     * Redistributions in binary form must reproduce the above copyright
  15.   15      *       notice, this list of conditions and the following disclaimer in the
  16.   16      *       documentation and/or other materials provided with the distribution.
  17.   17      *     * Neither the name of the <organization> nor the
  18.   18      *       names of its contributors may be used to endorse or promote products
  19.   19      *       derived from this software without specific prior written permission.
  20.   20      * 
  21.   21      * THIS SOFTWARE IS PROVIDED BY THE COPYRIGHT HOLDERS AND CONTRIBUTORS "AS IS" AND
  22.   22      * ANY EXPRESS OR IMPLIED WARRANTIES, INCLUDING, BUT NOT LIMITED TO, THE IMPLIED
  23.   23      * WARRANTIES OF MERCHANTABILITY AND FITNESS FOR A PARTICULAR PURPOSE ARE
  24.   24      * DISCLAIMED. IN NO EVENT SHALL <COPYRIGHT HOLDER> BE LIABLE FOR ANY
  25.   25      * DIRECT, INDIRECT, INCIDENTAL, SPECIAL, EXEMPLARY, OR CONSEQUENTIAL DAMAGES
  26.   26      * (INCLUDING, BUT NOT LIMITED TO, PROCUREMENT OF SUBSTITUTE GOODS OR SERVICES;
  27.   27      * LOSS OF USE, DATA, OR PROFITS; OR BUSINESS INTERRUPTION) HOWEVER CAUSED AND
  28.   28      * ON ANY THEORY OF LIABILITY, WHETHER IN CONTRACT, STRICT LIABILITY, OR TORT
  29.   29      * (INCLUDING NEGLIGENCE OR OTHERWISE) ARISING IN ANY WAY OUT OF THE USE OF THIS
  30.   30      * SOFTWARE, EVEN IF ADVISED OF THE POSSIBILITY OF SUCH DAMAGE.
  31.   31      * 
  32.   32      * Uses:
  33.   33      *      JSMin-php   https://github.com/rgrove/jsmin-php/
  34.   34      *      jQuery      http://jquery.com/
  35.   35      */
  36.   36 
  37.   37     /**
  38.   38      * PHP Error
  39.   39      * 
  40.   40      * --- --- --- --- --- --- --- --- --- --- --- --- --- --- --- --- ---
  41.   41      * 
  42.   42      * WARNING! It is downright _DANGEROUS_ to use this in production, on
  43.   43      * a live website. It should *ONLY* be used for development.
  44.   44      * 
  45.   45      * PHP Error will kill your environment at will, clear the output
  46.   46      * buffers, and allows HTML injection from exceptions.
  47.   47      * 
  48.   48      * In future versions it plans to do far more then that.
  49.   49      * 
  50.   50      * If you use it in development, awesome! If you use it in production,
  51.   51      * you're an idiot.
  52.   52      * 
  53.   53      * --- --- --- --- --- --- --- --- --- --- --- --- --- --- --- --- ---
  54.   54      * 
  55.   55      * = Info
  56.   56      * 
  57.   57      * A small API for replacing the standard PHP errors, with prettier
  58.   58      * error reporting. This will change the error reporting level, and this
  59.   59      * is deliberate, as I believe in strict development errors.
  60.   60      * 
  61.   61      * simple usage:
  62.   62      * 
  63.   63      *      \php_error\reportErrors();
  64.   64      * 
  65.   65      * Advanced example:
  66.   66      * 
  67.   67      * There is more too it if you want more customized error handling. You
  68.   68      * can pass in options, to customize the setup, and you get back a
  69.   69      * handler you can alter at runtime.
  70.   70      * 
  71.   71      *      $handler = new \php_error\ErrorHandler( $myOptions );
  72.   72      *      $handler->turnOn();
  73.   73      * 
  74.   74      * There should only ever be one handler! This is an (underdstandable)
  75.   75      * limitation in PHP. It's because if an exception or error is raised,
  76.   76      * then there is a single point of handling it.
  77.   77      * 
  78.   78      * = INI Options
  79.   79      * 
  80.   80      * - php_error.force_disabled When set to a true value (such as on),
  81.   81      *                            this forces this to be off.
  82.   82      *                            This is so you can disable this script
  83.   83      *                            in your production servers ini file,
  84.   84      *                            incase you accidentally upload this there.
  85.   85      * 
  86.   86      * --- --- --- --- --- --- --- --- --- --- --- --- --- --- --- --- ---
  87.   87      * 
  88.   88      * @author Joseph Lenton | https://github.com/josephlenton
  89.   89      */
  90.   90 
  91.   91     namespace php_error;
  92.   92 
  93.   93     use \php_error\ErrorException,
  94.   94         \php_error\FileLinesSet,
  95.   95         \php_error\ErrorHandler,
  96.   96 
  97.   97         \php_error\JSMin,
  98.   98         \php_error\JSMinException;
  99.   99 
  100.  100     use \Closure,
  101.  101         \Exception,
  102.  102         \InvalidArgumentException;
  103.  103 
  104.  104     use \ReflectionMethod,
  105.  105         \ReflectionFunction,
  106.  106         \ReflectionParameter;
  107.  107 
  108.  108     global $_php_error_already_setup,
  109.  109            $_php_error_global_handler,
  110.  110            $_php_error_is_ini_enabled;
  111.  111 
  112.  112     /*
  113.  113      * Avoid being run twice.
  114.  114      */
  115.  115     if ( empty($_php_error_already_setup) ) {
  116.  116         $_php_error_already_setup = true;
  117.  117 
  118.  118         /*
  119.  119          * These are used as token identifiers by PHP.
  120.  120          * 
  121.  121          * If they are missing, then they should never pop out of PHP,
  122.  122          * so we just give them their future value.
  123.  123          * 
  124.  124          * They are primarily here so I don't have to alter the 5.3
  125.  125          * compliant code. Instead I can delete pre-5.3 code (this
  126.  126          * code), in the future.
  127.  127          * 
  128.  128          * As long as the value is unique, and does not clash with PHP,
  129.  129          * then any number could be used. That is why they start counting
  130.  130          * at 100,000.
  131.  131          */
  132.  132         if ( ! defined('T_DIR') ) {
  133.  133             define( 'T_DIR', 100001 );
  134.  134         }
  135.  135         if ( ! defined('T_GOTO') ) {
  136.  136             define( 'T_GOTO', 100002 );
  137.  137         }
  138.  138         if ( ! defined('T_NAMESPACE') ) {
  139.  139             define( 'T_NAMESPACE', 100003 );
  140.  140         }
  141.  141         if ( ! defined('T_NS_C') ) {
  142.  142             define( 'T_NS_C', 100004 );
  143.  143         }
  144.  144         if ( ! defined('T_NS_SEPARATOR') ) {
  145.  145             define( 'T_NS_SEPARATOR', 100005 );
  146.  146         }
  147.  147         if ( ! defined('T_USE') ) {
  148.  148             define( 'T_USE', 100006 );
  149.  149         }
  150.  150 
  151.  151         /*
  152.  152          * Check if it's empty, in case this file is loaded multiple times.
  153.  153          */
  154.  154         if ( ! isset($_php_error_global_handler) ) {
  155.  155             $_php_error_global_handler = null;
  156.  156 
  157.  157             $_php_error_is_ini_enabled = false;
  158.  158 
  159.  159             /*
  160.  160              * check both 'disable' and 'disabled' incase it's mispelt
  161.  161              * check that display errors is on
  162.  162              * and ensure we are *not* a command line script.
  163.  163              */
  164.  164             $_php_error_is_ini_enabled = 
  165.  165                     ! @get_cfg_var( 'php_error.force_disabled' ) &&
  166.  166                     ! @get_cfg_var( 'php_error.force_disable'  ) &&
  167.  167                       @ini_get('display_errors') === '1'         &&
  168.  168                        PHP_SAPI !== 'cli'
  169.  169             ;
  170.  170         }
  171.  171 
  172.  172         /**
  173.  173          * This is shorthand for turning off error handling,
  174.  174          * calling a block of code, and then turning it on.
  175.  175          * 
  176.  176          * However if 'reportErrors' has not been called,
  177.  177          * then this will silently do nothing.
  178.  178          * 
  179.  179          * @param callback A PHP function to call.
  180.  180          * @return The result of calling the callback.
  181.  181          */
  182.  182         function withoutErrors( $callback ) {
  183.  183             global $_php_error_global_handler;
  184.  184 
  185.  185             if ( $_php_error_global_handler !== null ) {
  186.  186                 return $_php_error_global_handler->withoutErrors( $callback );
  187.  187             } else {
  188.  188                 return $callback();
  189.  189             }
  190.  190         }
  191.  191 
  192.  192         /**
  193.  193          * Turns on error reporting, and returns the handler.
  194.  194          * 
  195.  195          * If you just want error reporting on, then don't bother
  196.  196          * catching the handler. If you're building something
  197.  197          * clever, like a framework, then you might want to grab
  198.  198          * and use it.
  199.  199          * 
  200.  200          * Note that calling this a second time will replace the
  201.  201          * global error handling with a new error handler.
  202.  202          * The existing one will be turned off, and the new one
  203.  203          * turned on.
  204.  204          * 
  205.  205          * You can't use two at once!
  206.  206          * 
  207.  207          * @param options Optional, options declaring how PHP Error should be setup and used.
  208.  208          * @return The ErrorHandler used for reporting errors.
  209.  209          */
  210.  210         function reportErrors( $options=null ) {
  211.  211             $handler = new ErrorHandler( $options );
  212.  212             return $handler->turnOn();
  213.  213         }
  214.  214 
  215.  215         /**
  216.  216          * The actual handler. There can only ever be one.
  217.  217          */
  218.  218         class ErrorHandler
  219.  219         {
  220.  220             const REGEX_DOCTYPE = '/<( )*!( *)DOCTYPE([^>]+)>/';
  221.  221 
  222.  222             const REGEX_PHP_IDENTIFIER = '\b[a-zA-Z_\x7f-\xff][a-zA-Z0-9_\x7f-\xff]*';
  223.  223             const REGEX_PHP_CONST_IDENTIFIER = '/\b[A-Z_\x7f-\xff][A-Z0-9_\x7f-\xff]*/';
  224.  224 
  225.  225             /**
  226.  226              * Matches:
  227.  227              *  {closure}()
  228.  228              *  blah::foo()
  229.  229              *  foo()
  230.  230              * 
  231.  231              * It is:
  232.  232              *      a closure
  233.  233              *      or a method or function
  234.  234              *      followed by parenthesis '()'
  235.  235              * 
  236.  236              *      a function is 'namespace function'
  237.  237              *      a method is 'namespace class::function', or 'namespace class->function'
  238.  238              *      the whole namespace is optional
  239.  239              *          namespace is made up of an '\' and then repeating 'namespace\'
  240.  240              *          both the first slash, and the repeating 'namespace\', are optional
  241.  241              * 
  242.  242              * 'END' matches it at the end of a string, the other one does not.
  243.  243              */
  244.  244             const REGEX_METHOD_OR_FUNCTION_END = '/(\\{closure\\})|(((\\\\)?(\b[a-zA-Z_\x7f-\xff][a-zA-Z0-9_\x7f-\xff]*\\\\)*)?\b[a-zA-Z_\x7f-\xff][a-zA-Z0-9_\x7f-\xff]*(::[a-zA-Z_\x7f-\xff][a-zA-Z0-9_\x7f-\xff]*)?)\\(\\)$/';
  245.  245             const REGEX_METHOD_OR_FUNCTION     = '/(\\{closure\\})|(((\\\\)?(\b[a-zA-Z_\x7f-\xff][a-zA-Z0-9_\x7f-\xff]*\\\\)*)?\b[a-zA-Z_\x7f-\xff][a-zA-Z0-9_\x7f-\xff]*(::[a-zA-Z_\x7f-\xff][a-zA-Z0-9_\x7f-\xff]*)?)\\(\\)/';
  246.  246 
  247.  247             const REGEX_VARIABLE = '/\b[a-zA-Z_\x7f-\xff][a-zA-Z0-9_\x7f-\xff]*$/';
  248.  248 
  249.  249             const REGEX_MISSING_SEMI_COLON_FOLLOWING_LINE = '/^ *(return|}|if|while|foreach|for|switch)/';
  250.  250 
  251.  251             /**
  252.  252              * The number of lines to take from the file,
  253.  253              * where the error is reported. This is the number
  254.  254              * of lines around the line in question,
  255.  255              * including that line.
  256.  256              * 
  257.  257              * So '9' will be the error line + 4 lines above + 4 lines below.
  258.  258              */
  259.  259             const NUM_FILE_LINES = 13;
  260.  260 
  261.  261             const FILE_TYPE_APPLICATION = 1;
  262.  262             const FILE_TYPE_IGNORE      = 2;
  263.  263             const FILE_TYPE_ROOT        = 3;
  264.  264 
  265.  265             const PHP_ERROR_MAGIC_HEADER_KEY = 'PHP_ERROR_MAGIC_HEADER';
  266.  266             const PHP_ERROR_MAGIC_HEADER_VALUE = 'php_stack_error';
  267.  267             const MAGIC_IS_PRETTY_ERRORS_MARKER = '<!-- __magic_php_error_is_a_stack_trace_constant__ -->';
  268.  268 
  269.  269             const PHP_ERROR_INI_PREFIX = 'php_error';
  270.  270 
  271.  271             /**
  272.  272              * At the time of writing, scalar type hints are unsupported.
  273.  273              * By scalar, I mean 'string' and 'integer'.
  274.  274              * 
  275.  275              * If they do get added, this is here as a trap to turn scalar
  276.  276              * type hint warnings on and off.
  277.  277              */
  278.  278             private static $IS_SCALAR_TYPE_HINTING_SUPPORTED = false;
  279.  279 
  280.  280             private static $SCALAR_TYPES = array(
  281.  281                     'string', 'integer', 'float', 'boolean',
  282.  282                     'bool', 'int', 'number'
  283.  283             );
  284.  284 
  285.  285             /**
  286.  286              * A mapping of PHP internal symbols,
  287.  287              * mapped to descriptions of them.
  288.  288              */
  289.  289             private static $PHP_SYMBOL_MAPPINGS = array(
  290.  290                     '$end'                          => 'end of file',
  291.  291                     'T_ABSTRACT'                    => 'abstract',
  292.  292                     'T_AND_EQUAL'                   => "'&='",
  293.  293                     'T_ARRAY'                       => 'array',
  294.  294                     'T_ARRAY_CAST'                  => 'array cast',
  295.  295                     'T_AS'                          => "'as'",
  296.  296                     'T_BOOLEAN_AND'                 => "'&&'",
  297.  297                     'T_BOOLEAN_OR'                  => "'||'",
  298.  298                     'T_BOOL_CAST'                   => 'boolean cast',
  299.  299                     'T_BREAK'                       => 'break',
  300.  300                     'T_CASE'                        => 'case',
  301.  301                     'T_CATCH'                       => 'catch',
  302.  302                     'T_CLASS'                       => 'class',
  303.  303                     'T_CLASS_C'                     => '__CLASS__',
  304.  304                     'T_CLONE'                       => 'clone',
  305.  305                     'T_CLOSE_TAG'                   => 'closing PHP tag',
  306.  306                     'T_CONCAT_EQUAL'                => "'.='",
  307.  307                     'T_CONST'                       => 'const',
  308.  308                     'T_CONSTANT_ENCAPSED_STRING'    => 'string',
  309.  309                     'T_CONTINUE'                    => 'continue',
  310.  310                     'T_CURLY_OPEN'                  => '\'{$\'',
  311.  311                     'T_DEC'                         => '-- (decrement)',
  312.  312                     'T_DECLARE'                     => 'declare',
  313.  313                     'T_DEFAULT'                     => 'default',
  314.  314                     'T_DIR'                         => '__DIR__',
  315.  315                     'T_DIV_EQUAL'                   => "'/='",
  316.  316                     'T_DNUMBER'                     => 'number',
  317.  317                     'T_DOLLAR_OPEN_CURLY_BRACES'    => '\'${\'',
  318.  318                     'T_DO'                          => "'do'",
  319.  319                     'T_DOUBLE_ARROW'                => "'=>'",
  320.  320                     'T_DOUBLE_CAST'                 => 'double cast',
  321.  321                     'T_DOUBLE_COLON'                => "'::'",
  322.  322                     'T_ECHO'                        => 'echo',
  323.  323                     'T_ELSE'                        => 'else',
  324.  324                     'T_ELSEIF'                      => 'elseif',
  325.  325                     'T_EMPTY'                       => 'empty',
  326.  326                     'T_ENCAPSED_AND_WHITESPACE'     => 'non-terminated string',
  327.  327                     'T_ENDDECLARE'                  => 'enddeclare',
  328.  328                     'T_ENDFOR'                      => 'endfor',
  329.  329                     'T_ENDFOREACH'                  => 'endforeach',
  330.  330                     'T_ENDIF'                       => 'endif',
  331.  331                     'T_ENDSWITCH'                   => 'endswitch',
  332.  332                     'T_ENDWHILE'                    => 'endwhile',
  333.  333                     'T_EVAL'                        => 'eval',
  334.  334                     'T_EXIT'                        => 'exit call',
  335.  335                     'T_EXTENDS'                     => 'extends',
  336.  336                     'T_FILE'                        => '__FILE__',
  337.  337                     'T_FINAL'                       => 'final',
  338.  338                     'T_FOR'                         => 'for',
  339.  339                     'T_FOREACH'                     => 'foreach',
  340.  340                     'T_FUNCTION'                    => 'function',
  341.  341                     'T_FUNC_C'                      => '__FUNCTION__',
  342.  342                     'T_GLOBAL'                      => 'global',
  343.  343                     'T_GOTO'                        => 'goto',
  344.  344                     'T_HALT_COMPILER'               => '__halt_compiler',
  345.  345                     'T_IF'                          => 'if',
  346.  346                     'T_IMPLEMENTS'                  => 'implements',
  347.  347                     'T_INC'                         => '++ (increment)',
  348.  348                     'T_INCLUDE'                     => 'include',
  349.  349                     'T_INCLUDE_ONCE'                => 'include_once',
  350.  350                     'T_INSTANCEOF'                  => 'instanceof',
  351.  351                     'T_INT_CAST'                    => 'int cast',
  352.  352                     'T_INTERFACE'                   => 'interface',
  353.  353                     'T_ISSET'                       => 'isset',
  354.  354                     'T_IS_EQUAL'                    => "'=='",
  355.  355                     'T_IS_GREATER_OR_EQUAL'         => "'>='",
  356.  356                     'T_IS_IDENTICAL'                => "'==='",
  357.  357                     'T_IS_NOT_EQUAL'                => "'!=' or '<>'",
  358.  358                     'T_IS_NOT_IDENTICAL'            => "'!=='",
  359.  359                     'T_IS_SMALLER_OR_EQUAL'         => "'<='",
  360.  360                     'T_LINE'                        => '__LINE__',
  361.  361                     'T_LIST'                        => 'list',
  362.  362                     'T_LNUMBER'                     => 'number',
  363.  363                     'T_LOGICAL_AND'                 => "'and'",
  364.  364                     'T_LOGICAL_OR'                  => "'or'",
  365.  365                     'T_LOGICAL_XOR'                 => "'xor'",
  366.  366                     'T_METHOD_C'                    => '__METHOD__',
  367.  367                     'T_MINUS_EQUAL'                 => "'-='",
  368.  368                     'T_MOD_EQUAL'                   => "'%='",
  369.  369                     'T_MUL_EQUAL'                   => "'*='",
  370.  370                     'T_NAMESPACE'                   => 'namespace',
  371.  371                     'T_NEW'                         => 'new',
  372.  372                     'T_NUM_STRING'                  => 'array index in a string',
  373.  373                     'T_NS_C'                        => '__NAMESPACE__',
  374.  374                     'T_NS_SEPARATOR'                => 'namespace seperator',
  375.  375                     'T_OBJECT_CAST'                 => 'object cast',
  376.  376                     'T_OBJECT_OPERATOR'             => "'->'",
  377.  377                     'T_OLD_FUNCTION'                => 'old_function',
  378.  378                     'T_OPEN_TAG'                    => "'<?php' or '<?'",
  379.  379                     'T_OPEN_TAG_WITH_ECHO'          => "'<?php echo '",
  380.  380                     'T_OR_EQUAL'                    => "'|='",
  381.  381                     'T_PAAMAYIM_NEKUDOTAYIM'        => "'::'",
  382.  382                     'T_PLUS_EQUAL'                  => "'+='",
  383.  383                     'T_PRINT'                       => 'print',
  384.  384                     'T_PRIVATE'                     => 'private',
  385.  385                     'T_PUBLIC'                      => 'public',
  386.  386                     'T_PROTECTED'                   => 'protected',
  387.  387                     'T_REQUIRE'                     => 'require',
  388.  388                     'T_REQUIRE_ONCE'                => 'require_once',
  389.  389                     'T_RETURN'                      => 'return',
  390.  390                     'T_SL'                          => "'<<'",
  391.  391                     'T_SL_EQUAL'                    => "'<<='",
  392.  392                     'T_SR'                          => "'>>'",
  393.  393                     'T_SR_EQUAL'                    => "'>>='",
  394.  394                     'T_START_HEREDOC'               => "'<<<'",
  395.  395                     'T_STATIC'                      => 'static',
  396.  396                     'T_STRING'                      => 'string',
  397.  397                     'T_STRING_CAST'                 => 'string cast',
  398.  398                     'T_SWITCH'                      => 'switch',
  399.  399                     'T_THROW'                       => 'throw',
  400.  400                     'T_TRY'                         => 'try',
  401.  401                     'T_UNSET'                       => 'unset',
  402.  402                     'T_UNSET_CAST'                  => 'unset cast',
  403.  403                     'T_USE'                         => 'use',
  404.  404                     'T_VAR'                         => 'var',
  405.  405                     'T_VARIABLE'                    => 'variable',
  406.  406                     'T_WHILE'                       => 'while',
  407.  407                     'T_WHITESPACE'                  => 'whitespace',
  408.  408                     'T_XOR_EQUAL'                   => "'^='"
  409.  409             );
  410.  410 
  411.  411             private static $syntaxMap = array(
  412.  412                     'const'                       => 'syntax-literal',
  413.  413                     'reference_ampersand'         => 'syntax-function',
  414.  414 
  415.  415                     T_COMMENT                     => 'syntax-comment',
  416.  416                     T_DOC_COMMENT                 => 'syntax-comment',
  417.  417 
  418.  418                     T_ABSTRACT                    => 'syntax-keyword',
  419.  419                     T_AS                          => 'syntax-keyword',
  420.  420                     T_BREAK                       => 'syntax-keyword',
  421.  421                     T_CASE                        => 'syntax-keyword',
  422.  422                     T_CATCH                       => 'syntax-keyword',
  423.  423                     T_CLASS                       => 'syntax-keyword',
  424.  424 
  425.  425                     T_CONST                       => 'syntax-keyword',
  426.  426 
  427.  427                     T_CONTINUE                    => 'syntax-keyword',
  428.  428                     T_DECLARE                     => 'syntax-keyword',
  429.  429                     T_DEFAULT                     => 'syntax-keyword',
  430.  430                     T_DO                          => 'syntax-keyword',
  431.  431                     
  432.  432                     T_ELSE                        => 'syntax-keyword',
  433.  433                     T_ELSEIF                      => 'syntax-keyword',
  434.  434                     T_ENDDECLARE                  => 'syntax-keyword',
  435.  435                     T_ENDFOR                      => 'syntax-keyword',
  436.  436                     T_ENDFOREACH                  => 'syntax-keyword',
  437.  437                     T_ENDIF                       => 'syntax-keyword',
  438.  438                     T_ENDSWITCH                   => 'syntax-keyword',
  439.  439                     T_ENDWHILE                    => 'syntax-keyword',
  440.  440                     T_EXTENDS                     => 'syntax-keyword',
  441.  441 
  442.  442                     T_FINAL                       => 'syntax-keyword',
  443.  443                     T_FOR                         => 'syntax-keyword',
  444.  444                     T_FOREACH                     => 'syntax-keyword',
  445.  445                     T_FUNCTION                    => 'syntax-keyword',
  446.  446                     T_GLOBAL                      => 'syntax-keyword',
  447.  447                     T_GOTO                        => 'syntax-keyword',
  448.  448                     
  449.  449                     T_IF                          => 'syntax-keyword',
  450.  450                     T_IMPLEMENTS                  => 'syntax-keyword',
  451.  451                     T_INSTANCEOF                  => 'syntax-keyword',
  452.  452                     T_INTERFACE                   => 'syntax-keyword',
  453.  453 
  454.  454                     T_LOGICAL_AND                 => 'syntax-keyword',
  455.  455                     T_LOGICAL_OR                  => 'syntax-keyword',
  456.  456                     T_LOGICAL_XOR                 => 'syntax-keyword',
  457.  457                     T_NAMESPACE                   => 'syntax-keyword',
  458.  458                     T_NEW                         => 'syntax-keyword',
  459.  459                     T_PRIVATE                     => 'syntax-keyword',
  460.  460                     T_PUBLIC                      => 'syntax-keyword',
  461.  461                     T_PROTECTED                   => 'syntax-keyword',
  462.  462                     T_RETURN                      => 'syntax-keyword',
  463.  463                     T_STATIC                      => 'syntax-keyword',
  464.  464                     T_SWITCH                      => 'syntax-keyword',
  465.  465                     T_THROW                       => 'syntax-keyword',
  466.  466                     T_TRY                         => 'syntax-keyword',
  467.  467                     T_USE                         => 'syntax-keyword',
  468.  468                     T_VAR                         => 'syntax-keyword',
  469.  469                     T_WHILE                       => 'syntax-keyword',
  470.  470 
  471.  471                     // __VAR__ type magic constants
  472.  472                     T_CLASS_C                     => 'syntax-literal',
  473.  473                     T_DIR                         => 'syntax-literal',
  474.  474                     T_FILE                        => 'syntax-literal',
  475.  475                     T_FUNC_C                      => 'syntax-literal',
  476.  476                     T_LINE                        => 'syntax-literal',
  477.  477                     T_METHOD_C                    => 'syntax-literal',
  478.  478                     T_NS_C                        => 'syntax-literal',
  479.  479 
  480.  480                     T_DNUMBER                     => 'syntax-literal',
  481.  481                     T_LNUMBER                     => 'syntax-literal',
  482.  482 
  483.  483                     T_CONSTANT_ENCAPSED_STRING    => 'syntax-string',
  484.  484                     T_VARIABLE                    => 'syntax-variable',
  485.  485 
  486.  486                     // this is for unescaped strings, which appear differently
  487.  487                     // this includes function names
  488.  488                     T_STRING                      => 'syntax-function',
  489.  489 
  490.  490                     // in build keywords, which work like functions
  491.  491                     T_ARRAY                       => 'syntax-function',
  492.  492                     T_CLONE                       => 'syntax-function',
  493.  493                     T_ECHO                        => 'syntax-function',
  494.  494                     T_EMPTY                       => 'syntax-function',
  495.  495                     T_EVAL                        => 'syntax-function',
  496.  496                     T_EXIT                        => 'syntax-function',
  497.  497                     T_HALT_COMPILER               => 'syntax-function',
  498.  498                     T_INCLUDE                     => 'syntax-function',
  499.  499                     T_INCLUDE_ONCE                => 'syntax-function',
  500.  500                     T_ISSET                       => 'syntax-function',
  501.  501                     T_LIST                        => 'syntax-function',
  502.  502                     T_REQUIRE_ONCE                => 'syntax-function',
  503.  503                     T_PRINT                       => 'syntax-function',
  504.  504                     T_REQUIRE                     => 'syntax-function',
  505.  505                     T_UNSET                       => 'syntax-function'
  506.  506             );
  507.  507 
  508.  508             /**
  509.  509              * A list of methods which are known to call the autoloader,
  510.  510              * but should not error, if the class is not found.
  511.  511              * 
  512.  512              * They are allowed to fail, so we don't store a class not
  513.  513              * found exception if they do.
  514.  514              */
  515.  515             private static $SAFE_AUTOLOADER_FUNCTIONS = array(
  516.  516                     'class_exists',
  517.  517                     'interface_exists',
  518.  518                     'method_exists',
  519.  519                     'property_exists',
  520.  520                     'is_subclass_of'
  521.  521             );
  522.  522 
  523.  523             /**
  524.  524              * When returning values, if a mime type is set,
  525.  525              * then PHP Error should only output if the mime type
  526.  526              * is one of these.
  527.  527              */
  528.  528             private static $ALLOWED_RETURN_MIME_TYPES = array(
  529.  529                     'text/html',
  530.  530                     'application/xhtml+xml'
  531.  531             );
  532.  532 
  533.  533             private static function isIIS() {
  534.  534                 return (
  535.  535                                 isset($_SERVER['SERVER_SOFTWARE']) &&
  536.  536                                 strpos($_SERVER['SERVER_SOFTWARE'], 'IIS/') !== false
  537.  537                         ) || (
  538.  538                                 isset($_SERVER['_FCGI_X_PIPE_']) &&
  539.  539                                 strpos($_SERVER['_FCGI_X_PIPE_'], 'IISFCGI') !== false
  540.  540                         );
  541.  541             }
  542.  542             
  543.  543             /**
  544.  544              * This attempts to state if this is *not* a PHP request,
  545.  545              * but it cannot say if it *is* a PHP request. It achieves
  546.  546              * this by looking for a mime type.
  547.  547              *
  548.  548              * For example if the mime type is JavaScript, then we
  549.  549              * know it's not PHP. However there is no "yes, this is
  550.  550              * definitely a normal HTML response" flag we can check.
  551.  551              */
  552.  552             private static function isNonPHPRequest() {
  553.  553                 /*
  554.  554                  * Check if we are a mime type that isn't allowed.
  555.  555                  *
  556.  556                  * Anything other than 'text/html' or similar will cause
  557.  557                  * this to turn off.
  558.  558                  */
  559.  559                 $response = ErrorHandler::getResponseHeaders();
  560.  560 
  561.  561                 foreach ( $response as $key => $value ) {
  562.  562                     if ( strtolower($key) === 'content-type' ) {
  563.  563                         $found = true;
  564.  564 
  565.  565                         foreach ( ErrorHandler::$ALLOWED_RETURN_MIME_TYPES as $type ) {
  566.  566                             if ( stripos($value, $type) !== false ) {
  567.  567                                 $found = true;
  568.  568                                 break;
  569.  569                             }
  570.  570                         }
  571.  571 
  572.  572                         if ( ! $found ) {
  573.  573                             return true;
  574.  574                         }
  575.  575 
  576.  576                         break;
  577.  577                     }
  578.  578                 }
  579.  579 
  580.  580                 return false;
  581.  581             }
  582.  582 
  583.  583             /**
  584.  584              * Looks up a description for the symbol given,
  585.  585              * and if found, it is returned.
  586.  586              * 
  587.  587              * If it's not found, then the symbol given is returned.
  588.  588              */
  589.  589             private static function phpSymbolToDescription( $symbol ) {
  590.  590                 if ( isset(ErrorHandler::$PHP_SYMBOL_MAPPINGS[$symbol]) ) {
  591.  591                     return ErrorHandler::$PHP_SYMBOL_MAPPINGS[$symbol];
  592.  592                 } else {
  593.  593                     return "'$symbol'";
  594.  594                 }
  595.  595             }
  596.  596 
  597.  597             /**
  598.  598              * Attempts to syntax highlight the code snippet done.
  599.  599              * 
  600.  600              * This is then returned as HTML, ready to be dumped to the screen.
  601.  601              * 
  602.  602              * @param code An array of code lines to syntax highlight.
  603.  603              * @return HTML version of the code given, syntax highlighted.
  604.  604              */
  605.  605             private static function syntaxHighlight( $code ) {
  606.  606                 $syntaxMap = ErrorHandler::$syntaxMap;
  607.  607 
  608.  608                 // @supress invalid code raises a warning
  609.  609                 $tokens = @token_get_all( "<?php " . $code . " ?" . ">" );
  610.  610                 $html = array();
  611.  611                 $len = count($tokens)-1;
  612.  612                 $inString = false;
  613.  613                 $stringBuff = null;
  614.  614                 $skip = false;
  615.  615 
  616.  616                 for ( $i = 1; $i < $len; $i++ ) {
  617.  617                     $token = $tokens[$i];
  618.  618 
  619.  619                     if ( is_array($token) ) {
  620.  620                         $type = $token[0];
  621.  621                         $code = $token[1];
  622.  622                     } else {
  623.  623                         $type = null;
  624.  624                         $code = $token;
  625.  625                     }
  626.  626 
  627.  627                     // work out any whitespace padding
  628.  628                     if ( strpos($code, "\n") !== false && trim($code) === '' ) {
  629.  629                         if ( $inString ) {
  630.  630                             $html[]= "<span class='syntax-string'>" . join('', $stringBuff);
  631.  631                             $stringBuff = array();
  632.  632                         }
  633.  633                     } else if ( $code === '&' ) {
  634.  634                         if ( $i < $len ) {
  635.  635                             $next = $tokens[$i+1];
  636.  636 
  637.  637                             if ( is_array($next) && $next[0] === T_VARIABLE ) {
  638.  638                                 $type = 'reference_ampersand';
  639.  639                             }
  640.  640                         }
  641.  641                     } else if ( $code === '"' || $code === "'" ) {
  642.  642                         if ( $inString ) {
  643.  643                             $html[]= "<span class='syntax-string'>" . join('', $stringBuff) . htmlspecialchars($code) . "</span>";
  644.  644                             $stringBuff = null;
  645.  645                             $skip = true;
  646.  646                         } else {
  647.  647                             $stringBuff = array();
  648.  648                         }
  649.  649 
  650.  650                         $inString = !$inString;
  651.  651                     } else if ( $type === T_STRING ) {
  652.  652                         $matches = array();
  653.  653                         preg_match(ErrorHandler::REGEX_PHP_CONST_IDENTIFIER, $code, $matches);
  654.  654 
  655.  655                         if ( $matches && strlen($matches[0]) === strlen($code) ) {
  656.  656                             $type = 'const';
  657.  657                         }
  658.  658                     }
  659.  659 
  660.  660                     if ( $skip ) {
  661.  661                         $skip = false;
  662.  662                     } else {
  663.  663                         $code = htmlspecialchars( $code );
  664.  664 
  665.  665                         if ( $type !== null && isset($syntaxMap[$type]) ) {
  666.  666                             $class = $syntaxMap[$type];
  667.  667 
  668.  668                             if ( $type === T_CONSTANT_ENCAPSED_STRING && strpos($code, "\n") !== false ) {
  669.  669                                 $append = "<span class='$class'>" .
  670.  670                                             join(
  671.  671                                                     "</span>\n<span class='$class'>",
  672.  672                                                     explode( "\n", $code )
  673.  673                                             ) .
  674.  674                                         "</span>" ;
  675.  675                             } else if ( strrpos($code, "\n") === strlen($code)-1 ) {
  676.  676                                 $append = "<span class='$class'>" . substr($code, 0, strlen($code)-1) . "</span>\n";
  677.  677                             } else {
  678.  678                                 $append = "<span class='$class'>$code</span>";
  679.  679                             }
  680.  680                         } else if ( $inString && $code !== '"' ) {
  681.  681                             $append = "<span class='syntax-string'>$code</span>";
  682.  682                         } else {
  683.  683                             $append = $code;
  684.  684                         }
  685.  685 
  686.  686                         if ( $inString ) {
  687.  687                             $stringBuff[]= $append;
  688.  688                         } else {
  689.  689                             $html[]= $append;
  690.  690                         }
  691.  691                     }
  692.  692                 }
  693.  693 
  694.  694                 if ( $stringBuff !== null ) {
  695.  695                     $html[]= "<span class='syntax-string'>" . join('', $stringBuff) . '</span>';
  696.  696                     $stringBuff = null;
  697.  697                 }
  698.  698 
  699.  699                 return join( '', $html );
  700.  700             }
  701.  701 
  702.  702             /**
  703.  703              * Splits a given function name into it's 'class, function' parts.
  704.  704              * If there is no class, then null is returned.
  705.  705              * 
  706.  706              * It also returns these parts in an array of: array( $className, $functionName );
  707.  707              * 
  708.  708              * Usage:
  709.  709              * 
  710.  710              *      list( $class, $function ) = ErrorHandler::splitFunction( $name );
  711.  711              * 
  712.  712              * @param name The function name to split.
  713.  713              * @return An array containing class and function name.
  714.  714              */
  715.  715             private static function splitFunction( $name ) {
  716.  716                 $name = preg_replace( '/\\(\\)$/', '', $name );
  717.  717 
  718.  718                 if ( strpos($name, '::') !== false ) {
  719.  719                     $parts = explode( '::', $name );
  720.  720                     $className = $parts[0];
  721.  721                     $type = '::';
  722.  722                     $functionName = $parts[1];
  723.  723                 } else if ( strpos($name, '->') !== false ) {
  724.  724                     $parts = explode( '->', $name );
  725.  725                     $className = $parts[0];
  726.  726                     $type = '->';
  727.  727                     $functionName = $parts[1];
  728.  728                 } else {
  729.  729                     $className = null;
  730.  730                     $type = null;
  731.  731                     $functionName = $name;
  732.  732                 }
  733.  733 
  734.  734                 return array( $className, $type, $functionName );
  735.  735             }
  736.  736 
  737.  737             private static function newArgument( $name, $type=false, $isPassedByReference=false, $isOptional=false, $optionalValue=null, $highlight=false ) {
  738.  738                 if ( $name instanceof ReflectionParameter ) {
  739.  739                     $highlight = func_num_args() > 1 ?
  740.  740                             $highlight = $type :
  741.  741                             false;
  742.  742 
  743.  743                     $klass = $name->getDeclaringClass();
  744.  744                     $functionName = $name->getDeclaringFunction()->name;
  745.  745                     if ( $klass !== null ) {
  746.  746                         $klass = $klass->name;
  747.  747                     }
  748.  748 
  749.  749                     $export = ReflectionParameter::export(
  750.  750                             ( $klass ?
  751.  751                                     array( "\\$klass", $functionName ) :
  752.  752                                     $functionName ),
  753.  753                             $name->name, 
  754.  754                             true
  755.  755                     );
  756.  756 
  757.  757                     $paramType = preg_replace('/.*?(\w+)\s+\$'.$name->name.'.*/', '\\1', $export);
  758.  758                     if ( strpos($paramType, '[') !== false || strlen($paramType) === 0 ) {
  759.  759                         $paramType = null;
  760.  760                     }
  761.  761 
  762.  762                     return ErrorHandler::newArgument(
  763.  763                             $name->name,
  764.  764                             $paramType,
  765.  765                             $name->isPassedByReference(),
  766.  766                             $name->isDefaultValueAvailable(),
  767.  767                             ( $name->isDefaultValueAvailable() ?
  768.  768                                     var_export( $name->getDefaultValue(), true ) :
  769.  769                                     null ),
  770.  770                             ( func_num_args() > 1 ?
  771.  771                                     $type :
  772.  772                                     false )
  773.  773                     );
  774.  774                 } else {
  775.  775                     return array(
  776.  776                             'name'              => $name,
  777.  777                             'has_type'          => ( $type !== false ),
  778.  778                             'type'              => $type,
  779.  779                             'is_reference'      => $isPassedByReference,
  780.  780                             'has_default'       => $isOptional,
  781.  781                             'default_val'       => $optionalValue,
  782.  782                             'is_highlighted'    => $highlight
  783.  783                     );
  784.  784                 }
  785.  785             }
  786.  786 
  787.  787             private static function syntaxHighlightFunctionMatch( $match, &$stackTrace, $highlightArg=null, &$numHighlighted=0 ) {
  788.  788                 list( $className, $type, $functionName ) = ErrorHandler::splitFunction( $match );
  789.  789 
  790.  790                 // is class::method()
  791.  791                 if ( $className !== null ) {
  792.  792                     $reflectFun = new ReflectionMethod( $className, $functionName );
  793.  793                 // is a function
  794.  794                 } else if ( $functionName === '{closure}' ) {
  795.  795                     return '<span class="syntax-variable">$closure</span>';
  796.  796                 } else {
  797.  797                     $reflectFun = new ReflectionFunction( $functionName );
  798.  798                 }
  799.  799 
  800.  800                 if ( $reflectFun ) {
  801.  801                     $params = $reflectFun->getParameters();
  802.  802 
  803.  803                     if ( $params ) {
  804.  804                         $args = array();
  805.  805                         $min = 0;
  806.  806                         foreach( $params as $i => $param ) {
  807.  807                             $arg = ErrorHandler::newArgument( $param );
  808.  808 
  809.  809                             if ( ! $arg['has_default'] ) {
  810.  810                                 $min = $i;
  811.  811                             }
  812.  812 
  813.  813                             $args[]= $arg;
  814.  814                         }
  815.  815 
  816.  816                         if ( $highlightArg !== null ) {
  817.  817                             for ( $i = $highlightArg; $i <= $min; $i++ ) {
  818.  818                                 $args[$i]['is_highlighted'] = true;
  819.  819                             }
  820.  820 
  821.  821                             $numHighlighted = $min-$highlightArg;
  822.  822                         }
  823.  823 
  824.  824                         if ( $className !== null ) {
  825.  825                             if ( $stackTrace && isset($stackTrace[1]) && isset($stackTrace[1]['type']) ) {
  826.  826                                 $type = htmlspecialchars( $stackTrace[1]['type'] );
  827.  827                             }
  828.  828                         } else {
  829.  829                             $type = null;
  830.  830                         }
  831.  831 
  832.  832                         return ErrorHandler::syntaxHighlightFunction( $className, $type, $functionName, $args );
  833.  833                     }
  834.  834                 }
  835.  835 
  836.  836                 return null;
  837.  837             }
  838.  838 
  839.  839             /**
  840.  840              * Returns the values given, as HTML, syntax highlighted.
  841.  841              * It's a shorter, slightly faster, more no-nonsense approach
  842.  842              * then 'syntaxHighlight'.
  843.  843              * 
  844.  844              * This is for syntax highlighting:
  845.  845              *  - fun( [args] )
  846.  846              *  - class->fun( [args] )
  847.  847              *  - class::fun( [args] )
  848.  848              * 
  849.  849              * Class and type can be null, to denote no class, but are not optional.
  850.  850              */
  851.  851             private static function syntaxHighlightFunction( $class, $type, $fun, &$args=null ) {
  852.  852                 $info = array();
  853.  853 
  854.  854                 // set the info
  855.  855                 if ( isset($class) && $class && isset($type) && $type ) {
  856.  856                     if ( $type === '->' ) {
  857.  857                         $type = '-&gt;';
  858.  858                     }
  859.  859 
  860.  860                     $info []= "<span class='syntax-class'>$class</span>$type";
  861.  861                 }
  862.  862 
  863.  863                 if ( isset($fun) && $fun ) {
  864.  864                     $info []= "<span class='syntax-function'>$fun</span>";
  865.  865                 }
  866.  866 
  867.  867                 if ( $args ) {
  868.  868                     $info []= '( ';
  869.  869 
  870.  870                     foreach ($args as $i => $arg) {
  871.  871                         if ( $i > 0 ) {
  872.  872                             $info[]= ', ';
  873.  873                         }
  874.  874 
  875.  875                         if ( is_string($arg) ) {
  876.  876                             $info[]= $arg;
  877.  877                         } else {
  878.  878                             $highlight = $arg['is_highlighted'];
  879.  879                             $name = $arg['name'];
  880.  880 
  881.  881                             if ( $highlight ) {
  882.  882                                 $info[]= '<span class="syntax-higlight-variable">';
  883.  883                             }
  884.  884 
  885.  885                             if ( $name === '_' ) {
  886.  886                                 $info[]= '<span class="syntax-variable-not-important">';
  887.  887                             }
  888.  888 
  889.  889                             if ( $arg['has_type'] ) {
  890.  890                                 $info []= "<span class='syntax-class'>";
  891.  891                                     $info []= $arg['type'];
  892.  892                                 $info []= '</span> ';
  893.  893                             }
  894.  894 
  895.  895                             if ( $arg['is_reference'] ) {
  896.  896                                 $info []= '<span class="syntax-function">&amp;</span>';
  897.  897                             }
  898.  898 
  899.  899                             $info []= "<span class='syntax-variable'>\$$name</span>";
  900.  900 
  901.  901                             if ( $arg['has_default'] ) {
  902.  902                                 $info []= '=<span class="syntax-literal">' . $arg['default_val'] . '</span>';
  903.  903                             }
  904.  904 
  905.  905                             if ( $name === '_' ) {
  906.  906                                 $info[]= '</span>';
  907.  907                             }
  908.  908                             if ( $highlight ) {
  909.  909                                 $info[]= '</span>';
  910.  910                             }
  911.  911                         }
  912.  912                     }
  913.  913 
  914.  914                     $info []= ' )';
  915.  915                 } else {
  916.  916                     $info []= '()';
  917.  917                 }
  918.  918 
  919.  919                 return join( '', $info );
  920.  920             }
  921.  921 
  922.  922             /**
  923.  923              * Checks if the item is in options, and if it is, then it is removed and returned.
  924.  924              * 
  925.  925              * If it is not found, or if options is not an array, then the alt is returned.
  926.  926              */
  927.  927             private static function optionsPop( &$options, $key, $alt=null ) {
  928.  928                 if ( $options && isset($options[$key]) ) {
  929.  929                     $val = $options[$key];
  930.  930                     unset( $options[$key] );
  931.  931 
  932.  932                     return $val;
  933.  933                 } else {
  934.  934                     $iniAlt = @get_cfg_var( ErrorHandler::PHP_ERROR_INI_PREFIX . '.' . $key );
  935.  935 
  936.  936                     if ( $iniAlt !== false ) {
  937.  937                         return $iniAlt;
  938.  938                     } else {
  939.  939                         return $alt;
  940.  940                     }
  941.  941                 }
  942.  942             }
  943.  943 
  944.  944             private static function folderTypeToCSS( $type ) {
  945.  945                 if ( $type === ErrorHandler::FILE_TYPE_ROOT ) {
  946.  946                     return 'file-root';
  947.  947                 } else if ( $type === ErrorHandler::FILE_TYPE_IGNORE ) {
  948.  948                     return 'file-ignore';
  949.  949                 } else if ( $type === ErrorHandler::FILE_TYPE_APPLICATION ) {
  950.  950                     return 'file-app';
  951.  951                 } else {
  952.  952                     return 'file-common';
  953.  953                 }
  954.  954             }
  955.  955 
  956.  956             private static function isFolderType( &$folders, $longest, $file ) {
  957.  957                 $parts = explode( '/', $file );
  958.  958 
  959.  959                 $len = min( count($parts), $longest );
  960.  960 
  961.  961                 for ( $i = $len; $i > 0; $i-- ) {
  962.  962                     if ( isset($folders[$i]) ) {
  963.  963                         $folderParts = &$folders[ $i ];
  964.  964 
  965.  965                         $success = false;
  966.  966                         for ( $j = 0; $j < count($folderParts); $j++ ) {
  967.  967                             $folderNames = $folderParts[$j];
  968.  968 
  969.  969                             for ( $k = 0; $k < count($folderNames); $k++ ) {
  970.  970                                 if ( $folderNames[$k] === $parts[$k] ) {
  971.  971                                     $success = true;
  972.  972                                 } else {
  973.  973                                     $success = false;
  974.  974                                     break;
  975.  975                                 }
  976.  976                             }
  977.  977                         }
  978.  978 
  979.  979                         if ( $success ) {
  980.  980                             return true;
  981.  981                         }
  982.  982                     }
  983.  983                 }
  984.  984 
  985.  985                 return false;
  986.  986             }
  987.  987 
  988.  988             private static function setFolders( &$origFolders, &$longest, $folders ) {
  989.  989                 $newFolders = array();
  990.  990                 $newLongest = 0;
  991.  991 
  992.  992                 if ( $folders ) {
  993.  993                     if ( is_array($folders) ) {
  994.  994                         foreach ( $folders as $folder ) {
  995.  995                             ErrorHandler::setFoldersInner( $newFolders, $newLongest, $folder );
  996.  996                         }
  997.  997                     } else if ( is_string($folders) ) {
  998.  998                         ErrorHandler::setFoldersInner( $newFolders, $newLongest, $folders );
  999.  999                     } else {
  1000. 1000                         throw new Exception( "Unknown value given for folder: " . $folders );
  1001. 1001                     }
  1002. 1002                 }
  1003. 1003 
  1004. 1004                 $origFolders = $newFolders;
  1005. 1005                 $longest     = $newLongest;
  1006. 1006             }
  1007. 1007 
  1008. 1008             private static function setFoldersInner( &$newFolders, &$newLongest, $folder ) {
  1009. 1009                 $folder = str_replace( '\\', '/', $folder );
  1010. 1010                 $folder = preg_replace( '/(^\\/+)|(\\/+$)/', '', $folder );
  1011. 1011                 $parts  = explode( '/', $folder );
  1012. 1012                 $count  = count( $parts );
  1013. 1013 
  1014. 1014                 $newLongest = max( $newLongest, $count );
  1015. 1015                 
  1016. 1016                 if ( isset($newFolders[$count]) ) {
  1017. 1017                     $folds = &$newFolders[$count];
  1018. 1018                     $folds[]= $parts;
  1019. 1019                 } else {
  1020. 1020                     $newFolders[$count] = array( $parts );
  1021. 1021                 }
  1022. 1022             }
  1023. 1023 
  1024. 1024             private static function getRequestHeaders() {
  1025. 1025                 if ( function_exists('getallheaders') ) {
  1026. 1026                     return getallheaders();
  1027. 1027                 } else {
  1028. 1028                     $headers = array();
  1029. 1029                     
  1030. 1030                     foreach ( $_SERVER as $key => $value ) {
  1031. 1031                         if ( strpos($key, 'HTTP_') === 0 ) {
  1032. 1032                             $key = str_replace( " ", "-", ucwords(strtolower( str_replace("_", " ", substr($key, 5)) )) ); 
  1033. 1033                             $headers[ $key ] = $value;
  1034. 1034                         }
  1035. 1035                     }
  1036. 1036 
  1037. 1037                     return $headers;
  1038. 1038                 }
  1039. 1039             }
  1040. 1040 
  1041. 1041             private static function getResponseHeaders() {
  1042. 1042                 $headers = function_exists('apache_response_headers') ?
  1043. 1043                         apache_response_headers() :
  1044. 1044                         array() ;
  1045. 1045 
  1046. 1046                 /*
  1047. 1047                  * Merge the headers_list into apache_response_headers.
  1048. 1048                  * 
  1049. 1049                  * This is because sometimes things are in one, which are
  1050. 1050                  * not present in the other.
  1051. 1051                  */
  1052. 1052                 if ( function_exists('headers_list') ) {
  1053. 1053                     $hList = headers_list();
  1054. 1054 
  1055. 1055                     foreach ($hList as $header) {
  1056. 1056                         $header = explode(":", $header);
  1057. 1057                         $headers[ array_shift($header) ] = trim( implode(":", $header) );
  1058. 1058                     }
  1059. 1059                 }
  1060. 1060 
  1061. 1061                 return $headers;
  1062. 1062             }
  1063. 1063 
  1064. 1064             public static function identifyTypeHTML( $arg, $recurseLevels=1 ) {
  1065. 1065                 if ( ! is_array($arg) && !is_object($arg) ) {
  1066. 1066                     if ( is_string($arg) ) {
  1067. 1067                         return "<span class='syntax-string'>&quot;" . htmlentities($arg) . "&quot;</span>";
  1068. 1068                     } else {
  1069. 1069                         return "<span class='syntax-literal'>" . var_export( $arg, true ) . '</span>';
  1070. 1070                     }
  1071. 1071                 } else if ( is_array($arg) ) {
  1072. 1072                     if ( count($arg) === 0 ) {
  1073. 1073                         return "[]";
  1074. 1074                     } else if ( $recurseLevels > 0 ) {
  1075. 1075                         $argArr = array();
  1076. 1076 
  1077. 1077                         foreach ($arg as $ag) {
  1078. 1078                             $argArr[]= ErrorHandler::identifyTypeHTML( $ag, $recurseLevels-1 );
  1079. 1079                         }
  1080. 1080 
  1081. 1081                         if ( ($recurseLevels % 2) === 0 ) {
  1082. 1082                             return "["  . join(', ', $argArr) .  "]";
  1083. 1083                         } else {
  1084. 1084                             return "[ " . join(', ', $argArr) . " ]";
  1085. 1085                         }
  1086. 1086                     } else {
  1087. 1087                         return "[...]";
  1088. 1088                     }
  1089. 1089                 } else if ( get_class($arg) === 'Closure' ) {
  1090. 1090                     return '<span class="syntax-variable">$Closure</span>()';
  1091. 1091                 } else {
  1092. 1092                     $argKlass = get_class( $arg );
  1093. 1093 
  1094. 1094                     if ( preg_match(ErrorHandler::REGEX_PHP_CONST_IDENTIFIER, $argKlass) ) {
  1095. 1095                         return '<span class="syntax-literal">$' . $argKlass . '</span>';
  1096. 1096                     } else {
  1097. 1097                         return '<span class="syntax-variable">$' . $argKlass . '</span>';
  1098. 1098                     }
  1099. 1099                 }
  1100. 1100             }
  1101. 1101 
  1102. 1102             private $cachedFiles;
  1103. 1103 
  1104. 1104             private $isShutdownRegistered;
  1105. 1105             private $isOn;
  1106. 1106 
  1107. 1107             private $ignoreFolders = array();
  1108. 1108             private $ignoreFoldersLongest = 0;
  1109. 1109 
  1110. 1110             private $applicationFolders = array();
  1111. 1111             private $applicationFoldersLongest = 0;
  1112. 1112 
  1113. 1113             private $defaultErrorReportingOn;
  1114. 1114             private $defaultErrorReportingOff;
  1115. 1115             private $applicationRoot;
  1116. 1116             private $serverName;
  1117. 1117 
  1118. 1118             private $catchClassNotFound;
  1119. 1119             private $catchSurpressedErrors;
  1120. 1120             private $catchAjaxErrors;
  1121. 1121 
  1122. 1122             private $backgroundText;
  1123. 1123             private $numLines;
  1124. 1124 
  1125. 1125             private $displayLineNumber;
  1126. 1126             private $htmlOnly;
  1127. 1127 
  1128. 1128             private $isBufferSetup;
  1129. 1129             private $bufferOutputStr;
  1130. 1130             private $bufferOutput;
  1131. 1131 
  1132. 1132             private $isAjax;
  1133. 1133 
  1134. 1134             private $lastGlobalErrorHandler;
  1135. 1135 
  1136. 1136             private $classNotFoundException;
  1137. 1137 
  1138. 1138             /**
  1139. 1139              * = Options =
  1140. 1140              * 
  1141. 1141              * All options are optional, and so is passing in an options item.
  1142. 1142              * You don't have to supply any, it's up to you.
  1143. 1143              * 
  1144. 1144              * Note that if 'php_error.force_disable' is true, then this object
  1145. 1145              * will try to look like it works, but won't actually do anything.
  1146. 1146              * 
  1147. 1147              * All options can also be passed in from 'php.ini'. You do this
  1148. 1148              * by setting it with 'php_error.' prefix. For example:
  1149. 1149              * 
  1150. 1150              *      php_error.catch_ajax_errors = On
  1151. 1151              *      php_error.error_reporting_on = E_ALL | E_STRICT
  1152. 1152              * 
  1153. 1153              * Includes:
  1154. 1154              *  = Types of errors this will catch =
  1155. 1155              *  - catch_ajax_errors         When on, this will inject JS Ajax wrapping code, to allow this to catch any future JSON errors. Defaults to true.
  1156. 1156              *  - catch_supressed_errors    The @ supresses errors. If set to true, then they are still reported anyway, but respected when false. Defaults to false.
  1157. 1157              *  - catch_class_not_found     When true, loading a class that does not exist will be caught. This defaults to true.
  1158. 1158              * 
  1159. 1159              *  = Error reporting level =
  1160. 1160              *  - error_reporting_on        value for when errors are on, defaults to all errors
  1161. 1161              *  - error_reporting_off       value for when errors are off, defaults to php.ini's error_reporting.
  1162. 1162              * 
  1163. 1163              *  = Setup Details =
  1164. 1164              *  - application_root          When it's working out hte stack trace, this is the root folder of the application, to use as it's base.
  1165. 1165              *                              Defaults to the servers root directory.
  1166. 1166              * 
  1167. 1167              *                              A relative path can be given, but lets be honest, an explicit path is the way to guarantee that you
  1168. 1168              *                              will get the path you want. My relative might not be the same as your relative.
  1169. 1169              * 
  1170. 1170              *  - snippet_num_lines         The number of lines to display in the code snippet. 
  1171. 1171              *                              That includes the line being reported.
  1172. 1172              * 
  1173. 1173              *  - server_name               The name for this server, defaults to "$_SERVER['SERVER_NAME']"
  1174. 1174              * 
  1175. 1175              *  - ignore_folders            This is allows you to highlight non-framework code in a stack trace.
  1176. 1176              *                              An array of folders to ignore, when working out the stack trace.
  1177. 1177              *                              This is folder prefixes in relation to the application_root, whatever that might be.
  1178. 1178              *                              They are only ignored if there is a file found outside of them.
  1179. 1179              *                              If you still don't get what this does, don't worry, it's here cos I use it.
  1180. 1180              * 
  1181. 1181              *  - application_folders       Just like ignore, but anything found in these folders takes precedence
  1182. 1182              *                              over anything else.
  1183. 1183              * 
  1184. 1184              *  - background_text           The text that appeares in the background. By default this is blank.
  1185. 1185              *                              Why? You can replace this with the name of your framework, for extra customization spice.
  1186. 1186              * 
  1187. 1187              *  - html_only                 By default, PHP Error only runs on ajax and HTML pages.
  1188. 1188              *                              If this is false, then it will also run when on non-HTML
  1189. 1189              *                              pages too, such as replying with images of JavaScript
  1190. 1190              *                              from your PHP. Defaults to true.
  1191. 1191              * 
  1192. 1192              * @param options Optional, an array of values to customize this handler.
  1193. 1193              * @throws Exception This is raised if given an options that does *not* exist (so you know that option is meaningless).
  1194. 1194              */
  1195. 1195             public function __construct( $options=null ) {
  1196. 1196                 // there can only be one to rule them all
  1197. 1197                 global $_php_error_global_handler;
  1198. 1198                 if ( $_php_error_global_handler !== null ) {
  1199. 1199                     $this->lastGlobalErrorHandler = $_php_error_global_handler;
  1200. 1200                 } else {
  1201. 1201                     $this->lastGlobalErrorHandler = null;
  1202. 1202                 }
  1203. 1203                 $_php_error_global_handler = $this;
  1204. 1204 
  1205. 1205                 $this->cachedFiles = array();
  1206. 1206 
  1207. 1207                 $this->isShutdownRegistered = false;
  1208. 1208                 $this->isOn = false;
  1209. 1209 
  1210. 1210                 /*
  1211. 1211                  * Deal with the options.
  1212. 1212                  * 
  1213. 1213                  * They are removed one by one, and any left, will raise an error.
  1214. 1214                  */
  1215. 1215 
  1216. 1216                 $ignoreFolders                  = ErrorHandler::optionsPop( $options, 'ignore_folders'     , null );
  1217. 1217                 $appFolders                     = ErrorHandler::optionsPop( $options, 'application_folders', null );
  1218. 1218 
  1219. 1219                 if ( $ignoreFolders !== null ) {
  1220. 1220                     ErrorHandler::setFolders( $this->ignoreFolders, $this->ignoreFoldersLongest, $ignoreFolders );
  1221. 1221                 }
  1222. 1222                 if ( $appFolders !== null ) {
  1223. 1223                     ErrorHandler::setFolders( $this->applicationFolders, $this->applicationFoldersLongest, $appFolders );
  1224. 1224                 }
  1225. 1225 
  1226. 1226                 $this->defaultErrorReportingOn  = ErrorHandler::optionsPop( $options, 'error_reporting_on' , -1 );
  1227. 1227                 $this->defaultErrorReportingOff = ErrorHandler::optionsPop( $options, 'error_reporting_off', error_reporting() );
  1228. 1228 
  1229. 1229                 $this->applicationRoot          = ErrorHandler::optionsPop( $options, 'application_root'   , $_SERVER['DOCUMENT_ROOT'] );
  1230. 1230                 $this->serverName               = ErrorHandler::optionsPop( $options, 'error_reporting_off', $_SERVER['SERVER_NAME']   );
  1231. 1231 
  1232. 1232                 /*
  1233. 1233                  * Relative paths might be given for document root,
  1234. 1234                  * so we make it explicit.
  1235. 1235                  */
  1236. 1236                 $dir = @realpath( $this->applicationRoot );
  1237. 1237                 if ( ! is_string($dir) ) {
  1238. 1238                     throw new Exception("Document root not found: " . $this->applicationRoot);
  1239. 1239                 } else {
  1240. 1240                     $this->applicationRoot =  str_replace( '\\', '/', $dir );
  1241. 1241                 }
  1242. 1242 
  1243. 1243                 $this->catchClassNotFound       = !! ErrorHandler::optionsPop( $options, 'catch_class_not_found' , true  );
  1244. 1244                 $this->catchSurpressedErrors    = !! ErrorHandler::optionsPop( $options, 'catch_supressed_errors', false );
  1245. 1245                 $this->catchAjaxErrors          = !! ErrorHandler::optionsPop( $options, 'catch_ajax_errors'     , true  );
  1246. 1246 
  1247. 1247                 $this->backgroundText           = ErrorHandler::optionsPop( $options, 'background_text'       , ''    );
  1248. 1248                 $this->numLines                 = ErrorHandler::optionsPop( $options, 'snippet_num_lines'     , ErrorHandler::NUM_FILE_LINES        );
  1249. 1249                 $this->displayLineNumber        = ErrorHandler::optionsPop( $options, 'display_line_numbers'  , false );
  1250. 1250 
  1251. 1251                 $this->htmlOnly                 = !! ErrorHandler::optionsPop( $options, 'html_only', true );
  1252. 1252 
  1253. 1253                 $this->classNotFoundException   = null;
  1254. 1254 
  1255. 1255                 $wordpress = ErrorHandler::optionsPop( $options, 'wordpress', false );
  1256. 1256                 if ( $wordpress ) {
  1257. 1257                     // php doesn't like | in constants and privates, so just set it directly : (
  1258. 1258                     $this->defaultErrorReportingOn = E_ERROR | E_WARNING | E_PARSE | E_USER_DEPRECATED & ~E_DEPRECATED & ~E_STRICT;
  1259. 1259                 }
  1260. 1260 
  1261. 1261                 if ( $options ) {
  1262. 1262                     foreach ( $options as $key => $val ) {
  1263. 1263                         throw new InvalidArgumentException( "Unknown option given $key" );
  1264. 1264                     }
  1265. 1265                 }
  1266. 1266 
  1267. 1267                 $this->isAjax =
  1268. 1268                         isset( $_SERVER['HTTP_X_REQUESTED_WITH'] ) &&
  1269. 1269                         ( $_SERVER['HTTP_X_REQUESTED_WITH'] === 'XMLHttpRequest' );
  1270. 1270 
  1271. 1271                 $this->isBufferSetup = false;
  1272. 1272                 $this->bufferOutputStr = '';
  1273. 1273                 $this->bufferOutput = false;
  1274. 1274 
  1275. 1275                 $this->startBuffer();
  1276. 1276             }
  1277. 1277 
  1278. 1278             /*
  1279. 1279              * --- --- --- --- --- --- --- --- --- --- --- --- --- --- --- --- ---
  1280. 1280              * Public Functions
  1281. 1281              * --- --- --- --- --- --- --- --- --- --- --- --- --- --- --- --- ---
  1282. 1282              */
  1283. 1283 
  1284. 1284             /**
  1285. 1285              * @return true if this is currently on, false if not.
  1286. 1286              */
  1287. 1287             public function isOn() {
  1288. 1288                 return $this->isOn;
  1289. 1289             }
  1290. 1290 
  1291. 1291             /**
  1292. 1292              * @return If this is off, this returns true, otherwise false.
  1293. 1293              */
  1294. 1294             public function isOff() {
  1295. 1295                 return !$this->isOn;
  1296. 1296             }
  1297. 1297 
  1298. 1298             /**
  1299. 1299              * Turns error reporting on.
  1300. 1300              * 
  1301. 1301              * This will use the strictest error reporting available, or the
  1302. 1302              * level you pass in when creating this using the 'error_reporting_on'
  1303. 1303              * option.
  1304. 1304              * 
  1305. 1305              * @return This error reporting handler, for method chaining.
  1306. 1306              */
  1307. 1307             public function turnOn() {
  1308. 1308                 $this->propagateTurnOff();
  1309. 1309                 $this->setEnabled( true );
  1310. 1310 
  1311. 1311                 return $this;
  1312. 1312             }
  1313. 1313 
  1314. 1314             /**
  1315. 1315              * Turns error reporting off.
  1316. 1316              * 
  1317. 1317              * This will use the 'php.ini' setting for the error_reporting level,
  1318. 1318              * or one you have passed in if you used the 'error_reporting_off'
  1319. 1319              * option when creating this.
  1320. 1320              * 
  1321. 1321              * @return This error reporting handler, for method chaining.
  1322. 1322              */
  1323. 1323             public function turnOff() {
  1324. 1324                 $this->setEnabled( false );
  1325. 1325 
  1326. 1326                 return $this;
  1327. 1327             }
  1328. 1328 
  1329. 1329             /**
  1330. 1330              * Allows you to run a callback with strict errors turned off.
  1331. 1331              * Standard errors still apply, but this will use the default
  1332. 1332              * error and exception handlers.
  1333. 1333              * 
  1334. 1334              * This is useful for when loading libraries which do not
  1335. 1335              * adhere to strict errors, such as Wordpress.
  1336. 1336              * 
  1337. 1337              * To use:
  1338. 1338              * 
  1339. 1339              *      withoutErrors( function() {
  1340. 1340              *          // unsafe code here
  1341. 1341              *      });
  1342. 1342              * 
  1343. 1343              * This will use the error_reporting value for when this is
  1344. 1344              * turned off.
  1345. 1345              * 
  1346. 1346              * @param callback A PHP function to call.
  1347. 1347              * @return The result of calling the callback.
  1348. 1348              */
  1349. 1349             public function withoutErrors( $callback ) {
  1350. 1350                 if ( ! is_callable($callback) ) {
  1351. 1351                     throw new Exception( "non callable callback given" );
  1352. 1352                 }
  1353. 1353 
  1354. 1354                 if ( $this->isOn() ) {
  1355. 1355                     $this->turnOff();
  1356. 1356                     $result = $callback();
  1357. 1357                     $this->turnOn();
  1358. 1358 
  1359. 1359                     return $result;
  1360. 1360                 } else {
  1361. 1361                     return $callback();
  1362. 1362                 }
  1363. 1363             }
  1364. 1364             
  1365. 1365             /**
  1366. 1366              * This is the shutdown function, which should *only* be called 
  1367. 1367              * via 'register_shutdown_function'.
  1368. 1368              * 
  1369. 1369              * It's exposed because it has to be exposed.
  1370. 1370              */
  1371. 1371             public function __onShutdown() {
  1372. 1372                 global $_php_error_is_ini_enabled;
  1373. 1373                 
  1374. 1374                 if ( $_php_error_is_ini_enabled ) {
  1375. 1375                     if ( $this->isOn() ) {
  1376. 1376                         $error = error_get_last();
  1377. 1377 
  1378. 1378                         // fatal and syntax errors
  1379. 1379                         if (
  1380. 1380                                 $error && (
  1381. 1381                                         $error['type'] ===  1 ||
  1382. 1382                                         $error['type'] ===  4 ||
  1383. 1383                                         $error['type'] === 64
  1384. 1384                                 )
  1385. 1385                         ) {
  1386. 1386                             $this->reportError( $error['type'], $error['message'], $error['line'], $error['file'] );
  1387. 1387                         } else {
  1388. 1388                             $this->endBuffer();
  1389. 1389                         }
  1390. 1390                     } else {
  1391. 1391                         $this->endBuffer();
  1392. 1392                     }
  1393. 1393                 }
  1394. 1394             }
  1395. 1395 
  1396. 1396             /*
